baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is this an obstruction of justice offense covered by §2J1.2?

yesResult.description: Base offense level for obstruction of justice

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What is the nature of the conviction and applicable statutory maximum?

options.label: None of the below conditions apply
Convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1001 with 8-year statutory maximum for sex offenses (18 U.S.C. § 1591 or chapters 109A, 109B, 110, or 117)
Offense involved causing or threatening physical injury or property damage to obstruct justice
Convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1001 or § 1505 with 8-year statutory maximum for international or domestic terrorism

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense result in substantial interference with the administration of justice?

yesEffect.description: Offense resulted in substantial interference with the administration of justice

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve destruction/alteration of substantial number of records, selection of essential/probative records to destroy, or was otherwise extensive in scope, planning, or preparation?

yesEffect.description: Offense involved substantial destruction/alteration of records or was extensive in scope

2J1.3.title: Perjury or Subornation of Perjury; Bribery of Witness

noResult.description: Not applicable under this guideline section

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve causing or threatening to cause physical injury to a person, or property damage, in order to suborn perjury?

yesEffect.description: Offense involved causing or threatening to cause physical injury to a person, or property damage, in order to suborn perjury

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the perjury, subornation of perjury, or witness bribery result in substantial interference with the administration of justice?

yesEffect.description: Perjury, subornation of perjury, or witness bribery resulted in substantial interference with the administration of justice

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the impersonation committed for the purpose of conducting an unlawful arrest, detention, or search?

yesEffect.description: Impersonation committed for purpose of conducting unlawful arrest, detention, or search

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the offense in respect to a felony?

yesResult.description: Offense in respect to a felony

noResult.description: Offense in respect to a misdemeanor

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant voluntarily surrender within 96 hours of the time originally scheduled to report?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if base offense level is determined under subsection (a)(1)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant ordered to report to a community corrections center, community treatment center, halfway house, or similar facility?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if base offense level is determined under subsection (a)(1) and voluntary surrender within 96 hours does not apply

yesEffect.description: Ordered to report to community facility (reduction does not apply if defendant committed federal, state, or local offense punishable by one year or more while away)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What is the punishment range for the underlying offense?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if base offense level is determined under subsection (a)(2)

options.label: Felony punishable by less than 5 years

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the payment made or offered for refusing to testify or for the witness absenting himself to avoid testifying?

yesResult.description: Base level 6 + 4 level increase for payment to refuse testimony or avoid testifying

noResult.description: Base level for witness gratuity payment

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the payment made or offered for refusing to testify or for the witness absenting himself to avoid testifying?

yesEffect.description: Payment made or offered for refusing to testify or for witness absenting himself to avoid testifying
